sentences.english: Grocery stores, for example, will have pricing power they haven't experienced in years.
sentences.chinese: 例如百貨店，就擁有幾年前沒有的價格上的優勢。

sentences.english: A lot of drop-outs apply for work at the local grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 許多輟學學生申請到當地的百貨店上班。

sentences.english: I usually buy wool dress slacks after Christmas, when they go on sale at department stores.
sentences.chinese: 我通常會在聖誕節過後百貨店減價時買些毛料休閒褲。

sentences.english: Have you met celebrities in Bloomingdale's?
sentences.chinese: 你在布魯明戴爾百貨店見過名人嗎？

sentences.english: A: I’m buying for chain department stores in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 我爲加拿大的連鎖百貨店選購貨物。

sentences.english: The thriving Spring Festival shopping also drove up the sales of department stores and supermarkets.
sentences.chinese: 年貨發賣興旺帶動了百貨店和超市的發賣。

sentences.english: That store is known for ripping off the customers.
sentences.chinese: 那家百貨店以敲詐顧客而聞名。

sentences.english: There is a large store in the village.

definition: Yamaguchi prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
to open a business/to open a practice/open (for business)
a guild/(in olden times) an association such as a political party, religious group or trade guild/the Japanese word for company
BaiSheng, common name for Chinese company/PakSing, common Hong Kong company name
